description: The ability to image RNA identity and location with nanoscale precision in intact tissues is of great interest for defining cell types and states in normal and pathological biological settings. Here, we present a strategy for expansion microscopy of RNA. We developed a small-molecule linker that enables RNA to be covalently attached to a swellable polyelectrolyte gel synthesized throughout a biological specimen. Then, postexpansion, fluorescent in situ hybridization (FISH) imaging of RNA can be performed with high yield and specificity as well as single-molecule precision in both cultured cells and intact brain tissue. Expansion FISH (ExFISH) separates RNAs and supports amplification of single-molecule signals (i.e., via hybridization chain reaction) as well as multiplexed RNA FISH readout. ExFISH thus enables super-resolution imaging of RNA structure and location with diffraction-limited microscopes in thick specimens, such as intact brain tissue and other tissues of importance to biology and medicine.
before_start:
*Sodium Acrylate, purity note: check for yellow color upon resuspension: that indicates poor quality; solution should be clear (see http://expansionmicroscopy.org)

 

Stock solutions: 

 

MOPS Buffer: 20 mM MOPS pH 7.7

  • For conveniently adjusting the final volume, prepare the MOPS buffer at 10 times the final concentration (i.e. 200mM MOPS pH 7.7). When diluting LabelX in the MOPS buffer add nuclease-free water to bring the final concentration of the buffer to 20 mM MOPS pH 7.7.

 

Hybridization Buffer for smFISH: 10% (w/v) dextran sulfate, 10% (v/v) formamide, 2X SSC

  • Prepare the hybridization buffer without formamide and store it at 4°C. Add formamide right before performing FISH.

 

Hybridization Buffer for HCR-FISH: 10% (w/v) dextran sulfate, 20% (v/v) formamide, 2X SSC

  • Prepare the hybridization buffer without formamide and store it at 4°C. Add formamide right before FISH.

 

Wash Buffer for smFISH (WA-10): 10% (v/v) formamide, 2X SSC

  • Can be stored at room temperature for up to a week.

 

Wash Buffer for HCR-FISH (WA-20): 20% (v/v) formamide, 2X SSC

  • Can be stored at room temperature for up to a week.

 

5x SSCT: 5x SSC, 0.1% Tween-20

  • Can be stored at room temperature.

 

0.05x SSCT: 0.05x SSC, 0.1% Tween-20

  • Can be stored at room temperature.

 

Amplification buffer: 5x SSC, 10% (w/v) dextran sulfate, 0.1% Tween-20

  • Store at 4°C.

 

Digestion Buffer: 50 mM Tris pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA, 0.5% Triton X-100, 1M NaCl

  • Can be stored at room temperature.

  • Add Proteinase K (NEB, 1:100, final concentration 8 units/mL) to digestion buffer before use.
warning: Please refer to the SDS (Saftey Data Sheet) for safety warnings and hazard information.
protocol_affiliation: Massachusetts Institute of Technology,University of Pennsylvania,Harvard University
manuscript_citation: Chen F. (2016). Nanoscale imaging of RNA with expansion microscopy. Nature Methods 13, 679–684 (2016) doi: 10.1038/nmeth.3899

groups.group_name: Human Cell Atlas Method Development Community

keywords: Fluorescence imaging, Fluorescence in situ hybridization, Molecular neuroscience, Super-resolution microscopy

collections.protocol_name: ExFISH Protocols For Cells and Tissues
collections.protocol_name_html: ExFISH Protocols For Cells and Tissues

authors: Fei Chen,Asmamaw T Wassie,Allison J Cote,Anubhav Sinha,Shahar Alon,Shoh Asano,Evan R Daugharthy,Jae-Byum Chang,Adam Marblestone,George M Church,Arjun Raj,Edward S Boyden
guidelines:
Preparation of LabelX:

  • Label-IT amine nucleic acid labeling reagent purchased from Mirus Bio.: https://www.mirusbio.com/products/labeling/label-it-nucleic-acid-modifying-reagent

  • Resuspend Label-IT amine at 1 mg/mL using the provided resuspension buffer. Add the resuspension buffer and vortex to mix.

  • Resuspend acryloyl X SE (AcX) (https://www.lifetechnologies.com/order/catalog/product/A20770) in 500 µL anhydrous DMSO (10 mg/mL stock solution). Aliquot in 20 µL and store desiccated at -20°C.

  • React the Label-IT to AcX at equal mass ratio. For example, add 1 µL of acryloyl X to 10 µL of Label-IT (both are resuspended in DMSO so the reaction is carried out in DMSO). React for >6 hrs at room temperature on benchtop shaker. Store the LabelX at -20°C with desiccant for future use.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 1 of ExFISH - Cultured Cell Methods
source_data.annotation: For ease of gelation and imaging, and handling, we have found 16-well Culturewell removable chambered coverglass from Grace Bio Labs (Sigma catalog: GBL112358-8EA) to be great for before imaging, as well as subsequent gelation and digestion. In cases where smFISH is performed before gelation and expansion, we found it convenient to plate cells in 8 well Nunc Lab-Tek Chambered Coverglasses (Thermo Fisher: 155411).
source_data.thread_text: For ease of gelation and imaging, and handling, we have found 16-well Culturewell removable chambered coverglass from Grace Bio Labs (Sigma catalog: GBL112358-8EA) to be great for before imaging, as well as subsequent gelation and digestion. In cases where smFISH is performed before gelation and expansion, we found it convenient to plate cells in 8 well Nunc Lab-Tek Chambered Coverglasses (Thermo Fisher: 155411).

In cases where smFISH is performed before gelation and expansion, we found it convenient to plate cells in 8 well Nunc Lab-Tek Chambered Coverglasses (Thermo Fisher: 155411).

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 10 of ExFISH - Cultured Cell Methods
source_data.annotation: We have observed nearly complete RNA retention when using LabelX at a final Label-IT amine concentration of 0.006 - 0.02 mg/ml. For smFISH experiments, we recommend using a final Label-IT amine concentration of 0.006 mg/ml, since higher concentrations result in somewhat dimmer smFISH staining.

For smFISH experiments, we recommend using a final Label-IT amine concentration of 0.006 mg/ml, since higher concentrations result in somewhat dimmer smFISH staining.

For smFISH experiments, we recommend using a final Label-IT amine concentration of 0.006 mg/ml, since higher concentrations result in somewhat dimmer smFISH staining.

components.data:
Remove the preincubation MOPS buffer and add to the cultured cells LabelX in MOPS buffer. 

  • For cells grown in Grace Bio labs removable coverglasses, use 80µl.
  • For cells grown in Nunc Lab-Tek chambered coverglasses, use 120µl.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 15 of ExFISH - Cultured Cell Methods
source_data.annotation: Expansion speed is generally limited by the diffusion time of salt and water out/into the gel, thus casting thin gels will generally speed up expansion time. The Grace Bio labs removable coverglass has a removable chamber upper structure which can be removed via a removal tool (Sigma catalog: GBL103259). After removal of the chamber, a 1 mm silicone spacer remains with the coverslip and can be used to cast the gel. If cells are grown on coverglass, then a chamber similar to the slice gelation chamber can be made using coverslip spacers. If cells are grown in Nunc Lab-Tek Chambered Coverglass, we have found that the bottom coverglass along with its 1 mm gasket can be removed from the rest of the plate.
source_data.thread_text: Expansion speed is generally limited by the diffusion time of salt and water out/into the gel, thus casting thin gels will generally speed up expansion time. The Grace Bio labs removable coverglass has a removable chamber upper structure which can be removed via a removal tool (Sigma catalog: GBL103259). After removal of the chamber, a 1 mm silicone spacer remains with the coverslip and can be used to cast the gel. If cells are grown on coverglass, then a chamber similar to the slice gelation chamber can be made using coverslip spacers. If cells are grown in Nunc Lab-Tek Chambered Coverglass, we have found that the bottom coverglass along with its 1 mm gasket can be removed from the rest of the plate.
source_data.body: Expansion speed is generally limited by the diffusion time of salt and water out/into the gel, thus casting thin gels will generally speed up expansion time. The Grace Bio labs removable coverglass has a removable chamber upper structure which can be removed via a removal tool (Sigma catalog: GBL103259). After removal of the chamber, a 1 mm silicone spacer remains with the coverslip and can be used to cast the gel. If cells are grown on coverglass, then a chamber similar to the slice gelation chamber can be made using coverslip spacers. If cells are grown in Nunc Lab-Tek Chambered Coverglass, we have found that the bottom coverglass along with its 1 mm gasket can be removed from the rest of the plate.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 15 of ExFISH - Cultured Cell Methods
source_data.annotation:
• For Grace Bio labs removable coverglass, use the removal tool to remove the top wells leaving behind the black silicone gasket. Leave 40µl of 1x PBS to keep cells hydrated.

 

  • For the Lab-Tek Chambered Coverglass, first glue the bottom of the coverglass to a 1mm thick microscope glass slide for mechanical support using epoxy glue. After the glue has cured, use a razor blade to tease apart the coverglass from the top wells leaving behind the plastic gasket. Leave 100µl 1x PBS to keep cells hydrated.
source_data.thread_text:
• For Grace Bio labs removable coverglass, use the removal tool to remove the top wells leaving behind the black silicone gasket. Leave 40µl of 1x PBS to keep cells hydrated.

 

  • For the Lab-Tek Chambered Coverglass, first glue the bottom of the coverglass to a 1mm thick microscope glass slide for mechanical support using epoxy glue. After the glue has cured, use a razor blade to tease apart the coverglass from the top wells leaving behind the plastic gasket. Leave 100µl 1x PBS to keep cells hydrated.
source_data.body:
• For Grace Bio labs removable coverglass, use the removal tool to remove the top wells leaving behind the black silicone gasket. Leave 40µl of 1x PBS to keep cells hydrated.

 

  • For the Lab-Tek Chambered Coverglass, first glue the bottom of the coverglass to a 1mm thick microscope glass slide for mechanical support using epoxy glue. After the glue has cured, use a razor blade to tease apart the coverglass from the top wells leaving behind the plastic gasket. Leave 100µl 1x PBS to keep cells hydrated.

components.data: Gelling and Digestion
components.name: Section

components.data:
[Prepare gelation solution on ice and degas]

 

Prepare gelation solution by mixing monomer solution and VA-044 solutions on ice. Prepare VA-044 stocks fresh at 25% (w/v) in water. Dilute to a final concentration of 0.5% (w/v) in monomer solution. To prepare 1ml of gelation solution, add 20µl of VA-044 solution and 40µl of water to 940µl of monomer solution.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
[Prepare gelation solution on ice and degas]

 

Prepare gelation solution by mixing monomer solution and VA-044 solutions on ice. Prepare VA-044 stocks fresh at 25% (w/v) in water. Dilute to a final concentration of 0.5% (w/v) in monomer solution. To prepare 1ml of gelation solution, add 20µl of VA-044 solution and 40µl of water to 940µl of monomer solution.

components.data: Gelling and Digestion
components.name: Section

components.data:
[Prepare gelation solution on ice and degas]

 

In a cooling rack, or on ice, distribute the gelling solutions into 200µl aliquots in Eppendorf tubes. Degas for 10 mins in a vacuum desiccator.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
[Prepare gelation solution on ice and degas]

 

In a cooling rack, or on ice, distribute the gelling solutions into 200µl aliquots in Eppendorf tubes. Degas for 10 mins in a vacuum desiccator.

components.data: Gelling and Digestion
components.name: Section

components.data:
[Prepare gelation solution on ice and degas]

 

Remove any remaining PBS from the wells and add the gelling solution. 

  • For Grace Bio labs removable coverglass, add 40µl of gelling solution.
  • Add 200µl of gelling solution if using Lab-Tek Chambered Coverglass.

Place the coverglass in a vacuum desiccator and degas for another 10 mins.

 

In the meantime, prepare a glass slide covered in parafilm. Immediately, remove the coverglass from the dessicator and place the parafilm glass slide directly on top of the well. Any excess gelling solution might spill out to the sides. After this step, proceed to the following steps without delay.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
[Prepare gelation solution on ice and degas]

 

Remove any remaining PBS from the wells and add the gelling solution. 

  • For Grace Bio labs removable coverglass, add 40µl of gelling solution.
  • Add 200µl of gelling solution if using Lab-Tek Chambered Coverglass.

Place the coverglass in a vacuum desiccator and degas for another 10 mins.

 

In the meantime, prepare a glass slide covered in parafilm. Immediately, remove the coverglass from the dessicator and place the parafilm glass slide directly on top of the well. Any excess gelling solution might spill out to the sides. After this step, proceed to the following steps without delay.

components.data: Nitrogen perfusion and gelling
components.name: Section

components.data: The following steps require the use of a humidified chamber. The chamber provides a nitrogen filled environment for gelling and also minimizes evaporation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The following steps require the use of a humidified chamber. The chamber provides a nitrogen filled environment for gelling and also minimizes evaporation.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 19 of ExFISH - Cultured Cell Methods
source_data.annotation: We use a tupperware as a humidified chamber. To make the chamber humidified, we add a small amount of water to the bottom of the tupperware. We position an empty 24-well plastic bottom plate at the very bottom to provide a raised platform onto which we place the coverglass with the cells and gelling solution. Furthermore, we have bored two holes onto the cover of the tupperware using syringe needles to perfuse the chamber with nitrogen. The holes can be sealed with tape.
source_data.thread_text: We use a tupperware as a humidified chamber. To make the chamber humidified, we add a small amount of water to the bottom of the tupperware. We position an empty 24-well plastic bottom plate at the very bottom to provide a raised platform onto which we place the coverglass with the cells and gelling solution. Furthermore, we have bored two holes onto the cover of the tupperware using syringe needles to perfuse the chamber with nitrogen. The holes can be sealed with tape.
source_data.body: We use a tupperware as a humidified chamber. To make the chamber humidified, we add a small amount of water to the bottom of the tupperware. We position an empty 24-well plastic bottom plate at the very bottom to provide a raised platform onto which we place the coverglass with the cells and gelling solution. Furthermore, we have bored two holes onto the cover of the tupperware using syringe needles to perfuse the chamber with nitrogen. The holes can be sealed with tape.

components.data: Nitrogen perfusion and gelling
components.name: Section

components.data: After placing the parafilm-covered glass slide on top of the coverglass, place the coverglass onto the platform in the tupperware. Seal the tupperware shut.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After placing the parafilm-covered glass slide on top of the coverglass, place the coverglass onto the platform in the tupperware. Seal the tupperware shut.

components.data: Nitrogen perfusion and gelling
components.name: Section

components.data: Remove the tapes covering the holes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the tapes covering the holes.

components.data: Nitrogen perfusion and gelling
components.name: Section

components.data: Insert the inlet of the nitrogen line through one hole.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Insert the inlet of the nitrogen line through one hole.

components.data: Nitrogen perfusion and gelling
components.name: Section

components.data: Slowly, turn on the regulator to start the flow of nitrogen into the chamber. Increase the flow until you can feel the airflow coming out of the other hole. Flush the chamber with nitrogen for 10 mins. When done, immediately remove the inlet and tape the holes shut with electric tape.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Slowly, turn on the regulator to start the flow of nitrogen into the chamber. Increase the flow until you can feel the airflow coming out of the other hole. Flush the chamber with nitrogen for 10 mins. When done, immediately remove the inlet and tape the holes shut with electric tape.

components.data: Nitrogen perfusion and gelling
components.name: Section

components.data: Place the chamber in a 60°C oven for 2hrs to initiate gelation.

components.data: Proteinase K Digestion and Expansion
components.name: Section

components.data: When gelation is finished, take out the cover glass from the humidified chamber and gently remove the parafilm-covered glass slide from the top of the wells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: When gelation is finished, take out the cover glass from the humidified chamber and gently remove the parafilm-covered glass slide from the top of the wells.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 25 of ExFISH - Cultured Cell Methods
source_data.annotation:
For Grace Biolabs removable coverglass, gently remove the black silicone gasket by peeling it off using your hands or a pair of tweezers.

For the Lab-Tek Chambered coverglass, do not attempt to remove the plastic gasket.
source_data.thread_text:
For Grace Biolabs removable coverglass, gently remove the black silicone gasket by peeling it off using your hands or a pair of tweezers.

For the Lab-Tek Chambered coverglass, do not attempt to remove the plastic gasket.
source_data.body:
For Grace Biolabs removable coverglass, gently remove the black silicone gasket by peeling it off using your hands or a pair of tweezers.

For the Lab-Tek Chambered coverglass, do not attempt to remove the plastic gasket.

components.data: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH
components.name: Section

source_data.section: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH

components.data:
[Reducing thickness of expanded gels] 

 

To shave down fully expanded gels to a thickness of 1mm, we use 1mm thick microscope glass slides as spacers as follows. 

 

Prepare a large plastic dish to use as a cutting board. We often use the plastic covers of Nunc 4-well rectangular plates (Thermo Fisher: 267061), although any similarly sized flat plastic surface will work.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
[Reducing thickness of expanded gels] 

 

To shave down fully expanded gels to a thickness of 1mm, we use 1mm thick microscope glass slides as spacers as follows. 

 

Prepare a large plastic dish to use as a cutting board. We often use the plastic covers of Nunc 4-well rectangular plates (Thermo Fisher: 267061), although any similarly sized flat plastic surface will work.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 34 of ExFISH - Cultured Cell Methods
source_data.annotation: In the following steps the thickness of expanded gels is reduced: since the gels formed in either of the above chambered coverglass have a thickness of ~1 mm before expansion, we want to facilitate efficient diffusion of probes through the gel by shaving the fully expanded gel to a thickness of 1mm.
source_data.thread_text: In the following steps the thickness of expanded gels is reduced: since the gels formed in either of the above chambered coverglass have a thickness of ~1 mm before expansion, we want to facilitate efficient diffusion of probes through the gel by shaving the fully expanded gel to a thickness of 1mm.
source_data.body: In the following steps the thickness of expanded gels is reduced: since the gels formed in either of the above chambered coverglass have a thickness of ~1 mm before expansion, we want to facilitate efficient diffusion of probes through the gel by shaving the fully expanded gel to a thickness of 1mm.

components.data: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH
components.name: Section

source_data.section: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH

components.data:
[Reducing thickness of expanded gels] 

 

Use epoxy to glue two 1mm thick microscope glass slides on their flat slide onto the plastic surface. Position the two glass slides such that they are aligned along their longest dimension with 2.5-3cm space in between. Allow the epoxy to dry.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
[Reducing thickness of expanded gels] 

 

Use epoxy to glue two 1mm thick microscope glass slides on their flat slide onto the plastic surface. Position the two glass slides such that they are aligned along their longest dimension with 2.5-3cm space in between. Allow the epoxy to dry.

Position a fully expanded gel in between the two glass slides on the plastic cover.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 36 of ExFISH - Cultured Cell Methods
source_data.annotation:
The expanded gel should fit in between the two glass slides. If not, cut the gel such that it fits.

Position the gel such that the side of the gel with cultured cells is facing the bottom.
source_data.thread_text:
The expanded gel should fit in between the two glass slides. If not, cut the gel such that it fits.

Position the gel such that the side of the gel with cultured cells is facing the bottom.
source_data.body:
The expanded gel should fit in between the two glass slides. If not, cut the gel such that it fits.

Position the gel such that the side of the gel with cultured cells is facing the bottom.

components.data: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH
components.name: Section

source_data.section: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH

components.data:
[Reducing thickness of expanded gels] 

 

Place a razor blade across the glass slides such that it bridges the slides. Slide the razor blade along the glass slides and through the gel to shave off everything except the bottom 1 mm of the gel containing the cells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
[Reducing thickness of expanded gels] 

 

Place a razor blade across the glass slides such that it bridges the slides. Slide the razor blade along the glass slides and through the gel to shave off everything except the bottom 1 mm of the gel containing the cells.

components.data: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH
components.name: Section

source_data.section: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH

components.data:
[Reducing thickness of expanded gels] 

 

Carefully collect the shaved gel and move to 1x PBS. Proceed to smFISH staining (next step).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
[Reducing thickness of expanded gels] 

 

Carefully collect the shaved gel and move to 1x PBS. Proceed to smFISH staining (next step).

components.data: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH
components.name: Section

source_data.section: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH

components.data: [smFISH staining] Pre-hybridize gels by incubating with wash buffer (WA-10) for 30 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: [smFISH staining] Pre-hybridize gels by incubating with wash buffer (WA-10) for 30 minutes at room temperature.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 39 of ExFISH - Cultured Cell Methods
source_data.annotation: Note to smFISH staining after gelation and expansion: staining can be performed in any container, though we often use glass bottom 24-well plates for the convenience of imaging right after staining.
source_data.thread_text: Note to smFISH staining after gelation and expansion: staining can be performed in any container, though we often use glass bottom 24-well plates for the convenience of imaging right after staining.
source_data.body: Note to smFISH staining after gelation and expansion: staining can be performed in any container, though we often use glass bottom 24-well plates for the convenience of imaging right after staining.

components.data: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH
components.name: Section

source_data.section: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH

components.data:
[smFISH staining] Prepare probes by diluting in smFISH hybridization buffer at the desired concentration.

Vortex to mix.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
[smFISH staining] Prepare probes by diluting in smFISH hybridization buffer at the desired concentration.

Vortex to mix.

components.data: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH
components.name: Section

source_data.section: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH

components.data: [smFISH staining] Remove the wash buffer from the gels.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: [smFISH staining] Remove the wash buffer from the gels.

components.data: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH
components.name: Section

source_data.section: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH

components.data: [smFISH staining] Add the hybridization buffer with probes onto the gels.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: [smFISH staining] Add the hybridization buffer with probes onto the gels.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 42 of ExFISH - Cultured Cell Methods
source_data.annotation: Add enough volume to completely cover the gel to be stained (for 24-well plates, 300µl).
source_data.thread_text: Add enough volume to completely cover the gel to be stained (for 24-well plates, 300µl).
source_data.body: Add enough volume to completely cover the gel to be stained (for 24-well plates, 300µl).

components.data: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH
components.name: Section

source_data.section: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH

components.data: [smFISH staining] Incubate overnight (or for > 6hrs) at 37°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: [smFISH staining] Incubate overnight (or for > 6hrs) at 37°C.

components.data: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH
components.name: Section

source_data.section: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH

components.data: [smFISH staining] Wash gels with excess volume of WA-10 at 37°C for 30 mins. (2/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: [smFISH staining] Wash gels with excess volume of WA-10 at 37°C for 30 mins. (2/2)

components.data: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH
components.name: Section

source_data.section: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH

components.data: [smFISH staining] Wash gels with excess volume (eg. 500µl for 24-well plates) of WA-10 at 37°C for 30 mins. (1/2)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: [smFISH staining] Wash gels with excess volume (eg. 500µl for 24-well plates) of WA-10 at 37°C for 30 mins. (1/2)

components.data: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH
components.name: Section

source_data.section: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH

components.data: [smFISH staining] Wash once with excess volume 1x PBS at 37°C for 30 mins.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: [smFISH staining] Wash once with excess volume 1x PBS at 37°C for 30 mins.

components.data: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH
components.name: Section

source_data.section: smFISH Staining of Cultured Cells after ExFISH

components.data: [smFISH staining] Perform imaging in 1x PBS or any other buffer of choice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: [smFISH staining] Perform imaging in 1x PBS or any other buffer of choice.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 47 of ExFISH - Cultured Cells
source_data.annotation: Determine expansion factor by salt concentration; 1x PBS results in ~2x expansion; dilute PBS in water to 0.02x PBS for ~ 3x expansion while still preserving hybridization.
source_data.thread_text: Determine expansion factor by salt concentration; 1x PBS results in ~2x expansion; dilute PBS in water to 0.02x PBS for ~ 3x expansion while still preserving hybridization.
source_data.body: Determine expansion factor by salt concentration; 1x PBS results in ~2x expansion; dilute PBS in water to 0.02x PBS for ~ 3x expansion while still preserving hybridization.
